description:
9.10 sinc
Generate a sinc kaiser-windowed low-pass, high-pass, band-pass, or band-reject FIR coefficients.

The resulting stream can be used with afir filter for filtering the audio signal.

The filter accepts the following options:
name: sinc

options.description: Set number of samples per each frame. Default is 1024.
options.name: nb_samples

options.description: Set low-pass frequency. Default is 0. If high-pass frequency is lower than low-pass frequency and low-pass frequency is higher than 0 then filter will create band-pass filter coefficients, otherwise band-reject filter coefficients.
options.name: lp

options.description: Set filter phase response. Default is 50. Allowed range is from 0 to 100.
options.name: phase

options.description: Set stop-band attenuation. Default is 120dB, allowed range is from 40 to 180 dB.
options.name: att

options.description: Set number of taps for high-pass filter.
options.name: hptaps

options.description: Set number of taps for low-pass filter.
options.name: lptaps
